card.name: Accelerated Mutation
card.ability: Target creature gets +X/+X until end of turn, where X is the highest converted mana cost among permanents you control.
card.flavor: Its food just got a lot smaller and its stomach a lot bigger.

card.name: Ageless Sentinels
card.ability:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
When Ageless Sentinels blocks, it becomes a Bird Giant, and it loses defender. (It's no longer a Wall. This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It becomes both creature type Giant and creature type Bird.
8/1/2005 : Once it stops being a Wall, it can attack because it also loses Defender.

card.name: Alpha Status
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+2 for each other creature on the battlefield that shares a creature type with it.
card.flavor: The best leaders are made by their followers.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Alpha Status counts each creature once if that creature shares at least one creature type with the enchanted creature.

card.name: Ambush Commander
card.ability:
Forests you control are 1/1 green Elf creatures that are still lands.
{1}{G}, Sacrifice an Elf: Target creature gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
card.ruling: 8/1/2008 : A noncreature permanent that turns into a creature is subject to the "summoning sickness" rule: It can only attack, and its {T} abilities can only be activated, if its controller has continuously controlled that permanent since the beginning of his or her most recent turn.

card.name: Ancient Ooze
card.ability: Ancient Ooze's power and toughness are each equal to the total converted mana cost of other creatures you control.
card.flavor: The ooze has always been. The ooze will always be.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You add up the converted mana cost of all other creatures you control. Remember that tokens and face-down creatures have a cost of zero.

card.name: Aphetto Runecaster
card.ability: Whenever a permanent is turned face up, you may draw a card.
card.flavor: "The ignorant fear change; the wise use it as a weapon."
card.ruling: 5/1/2007 : Triggers when any permanent is turned face up, not just a creature.

card.name: Ark of Blight
card.ability: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice Ark of Blight: Destroy target land.
card.flavor: When opened, it erases entire landscapes from minds and maps.

card.name: Astral Steel
card.ability:
Target creature gets +1/+2 until end of turn.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

card.name: Aven Farseer
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever a permanent is turned face up, put a +1/+1 counter on Aven Farseer.
card.flavor: His enemies' trickery and deceit only fuel his righteous anger.

card.name: Aven Liberator
card.ability:
Flying
Morph {3}{W} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Aven Liberator is turned face up, target creature you control gains protection from the color of your choice until end of turn.

card.name: Bladewing the Risen
card.ability:
Flying
When Bladewing the Risen enters the battlefield, you may return target Dragon permanent card from your graveyard to the battlefield.
{B}{R}: Dragon creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Bladewing's Thrall
card.ability:
Bladewing's Thrall has flying as long as you control a Dragon.
When a Dragon enters the battlefield, you may return Bladewing's Thrall from your graveyard to the battlefield.

card.name: Bonethorn Valesk
card.ability: Whenever a permanent is turned face up, Bonethorn Valesk deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Barbarians weave its spurs into ceremonial charms to proclaim their hardiness in battle.
card.ruling: 5/1/2007 : Triggers when any permanent is turned face up, not just a creature.

card.name: Brain Freeze
card.ability:
Target player puts the top three cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

card.name: Break Asunder
card.ability:
Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor: "No good will come of this."
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Cabal Conditioning
card.ability: Any number of target players each discard a number of cards equal to the highest converted mana cost among permanents you control.
card.flavor:
"Hear only the Cabal's voice.
See only the Cabal's way.
Speak only the Cabal's word."
—Cabal mantra

card.name: Cabal Interrogator
card.ability: {X}{B}, {T}: Target player reveals X cards from his or her hand and you choose one of them. That player discards that card. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.

card.name: Call to the Grave
card.ability:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player sacrifices a non-Zombie creature.
At the beginning of the end step, if no creatures are on the battlefield, sacrifice Call to the Grave.
card.ruling:
9/22/2011 : If a player controls no creatures, or each creature he or she controls is a Zombie, that player does nothing when the first ability resolves.
9/22/2011 : If there is at least one creature on the battlefield at the beginning of the end step, the last ability won't trigger. If it does trigger, but a creature enters the battlefield before it resolves, the ability won't do anything when it resolves. Call to the Grave's controller won't sacrifice it.
9/22/2011 : In a Two-Headed Giant game, Call to the Grave will trigger twice during each team's upkeep, once for each player. Each of the two players will sacrifice a non-Zombie creature when the ability referring to that player resolves.

card.name: Carbonize
card.ability: Carbonize deals 3 damage to target creature or player. That creature can't be regenerated this turn. If the creature would die this turn, exile it instead.

card.name: Carrion Feeder
card.ability:
Carrion Feeder can't block.
Sacrifice a creature: Put a +1/+1 counter on Carrion Feeder.
card.flavor: Stinking of rot, it leaps between gravestones in search of its next meal.

card.name: Chartooth Cougar
card.ability:
{R}: Chartooth Cougar gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
Mountaincycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Mountain card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : Unlike the normal cycling ability, Mountaincycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Mountain card. After you find a Mountain card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
2/1/2009 : Mountaincycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Mountaincycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Mountaincycling from being activated.
2/1/2009 : Mountaincycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Mountaincycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
2/1/2009 : You can choose to find any card with the Mountain land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Mountain card in your library.

card.name: Chill Haunting
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Chill Haunting, exile X creature cards from your graveyard.
Target creature gets -X/-X until end of turn.

card.name: Claws of Wirewood
card.ability:
Claws of Wirewood deals 3 damage to each creature with flying and each player.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor: They say the forest has eyes. They never mention its claws.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Clutch of Undeath
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +3/+3 as long as it's a Zombie. Otherwise, it gets -3/-3.
card.flavor: The hand of death recognizes its own.

card.name: Coast Watcher
card.ability: Flying, protection from green
card.flavor: The aven came to fear the forest's clawing branches, but the watchers quickly renewed their courage.

card.name: Consumptive Goo
card.ability: {2}{B}{B}: Target creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn. Put a +1/+1 counter on Consumptive Goo.
card.flavor: Silent as fog and relentless as plague, it is wet, creeping death.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If it targets itself, it gets both -1/-1 and the +1/+1 counter during resolution. Since state-based actions (like being at zero toughness) are not checked until resolution is done, it does not die.

card.name: Daru Spiritualist
card.ability: Whenever a Cleric creature you control becomes the target of a spell or ability, it gets +0/+2 until end of turn.
card.flavor: He lifts the spirits of his people so they may descend in wrath upon their foes.

card.name: Daru Warchief
card.ability:
Soldier spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Soldier creatures you control get +1/+2.
card.flavor: His victories speak for him.

card.name: Dawn Elemental
card.ability:
Flying
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Dawn Elemental.
card.flavor: It was midnight on the Daru Plains, yet it seemed the sun was rising.

card.name: Day of the Dragons
card.ability:
When Day of the Dragons enters the battlefield, exile all creatures you control. Then put that many 5/5 red Dragon creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.
When Day of the Dragons leaves the battlefield, sacrifice all Dragons you control. Then return the exiled cards to the battlefield under your control.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The exiled cards are face up while exiled.
10/4/2004 : The exiled cards return to the battlefield face up.

card.name: Death's-Head Buzzard
card.ability:
Flying
When Death's-Head Buzzard dies, all creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Infested with vermin, ever hungering, dropping from night's sky.

card.name: Decree of Annihilation
card.ability:
Exile all artifacts, creatures, and lands from the battlefield, all cards from all graveyards, and all cards from all hands.
Cycling {5}{R}{R} ({5}{R}{R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Annihilation, destroy all lands.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
10/1/2008 : When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.
10/1/2008 : The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability is countered (with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.

card.name: Decree of Justice
card.ability:
Put X 4/4 white Angel creature tokens with flying onto the battlefield.
Cycling {2}{W} ({2}{W}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Justice, you may pay {X}. If you do, put X 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The two X's in the mana cost mean that you pay 2 mana (above the {2}{W}{W} base cost) for each token you want to create.
10/4/2004 : When you cycle this card, the last ability triggers. When that ability resolves, you choose a value of X and pay it during resolution.
10/4/2004 : You can cast this with X=0.
10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
10/1/2008 : When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.
10/1/2008 : The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability is countered (with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.

card.name: Decree of Pain
card.ability:
Destroy all creatures. They can't be regenerated. Draw a card for each creature destroyed this way.
Cycling {3}{B}{B} ({3}{B}{B}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Pain, all creatures get -2/-2 until end of turn.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
10/1/2008 : When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.
10/1/2008 : The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability is countered (with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.

card.name: Decree of Savagery
card.ability:
Put four +1/+1 counters on each creature you control.
Cycling {4}{G}{G} ({4}{G}{G}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Savagery, you may put four +1/+1 counters on target creature.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
10/1/2008 : When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.
10/1/2008 : The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability is countered (with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
10/1/2008 : You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

card.name: Decree of Silence
card.ability:
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, counter that spell and put a depletion counter on Decree of Silence. If there are three or more depletion counters on Decree of Silence, sacrifice it.
Cycling {4}{U}{U} ({4}{U}{U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When you cycle Decree of Silence, you may counter target spell.
card.ruling:
10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
10/1/2008 : When you cycle this card, first the cycling ability goes on the stack, then the triggered ability goes on the stack on top of it. The triggered ability will resolve before you draw a card from the cycling ability.
10/1/2008 : The cycling ability and the triggered ability are separate. If the triggered ability is countered (with Stifle, for example, or if all its targets have become illegal), the cycling ability will still resolve and you'll draw a card.
10/1/2008 : You can cycle this card even if there are no targets for the triggered ability. That's because the cycling ability itself has no targets.

card.name: Dimensional Breach
card.ability: Exile all permanents. For as long as any of those cards remain exiled, at the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player returns one of the exiled cards he or she owns to the battlefield.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : Each player chooses which one of their exiled cards to return during each of their upkeeps.
10/4/2004 : Remember that the returned creature just came under your control, so it can't attack until you start a turn with it under your control.
10/4/2004 : You can't pick a card that can't legally be returned to the battlefield. If there are no cards that can be legally returned, then you can't pick one.

card.name: Dispersal Shield
card.ability: Counter target spell if its converted mana cost is less than or equal to the highest converted mana cost among permanents you control.
card.flavor: "Maybe next time."

card.name: Divergent Growth
card.ability: Until end of turn, lands you control gain "{T}: Add one mana of any color to your mana pool."
card.flavor: Nature has forgotten its own rules.

card.name: Dragon Breath
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has haste.
{R}: Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 until end of turn.
When a creature with converted mana cost 6 or greater enters the battlefield, you may return Dragon Breath from your graveyard to the battlefield attached to that creature.

card.name: Dragon Fangs
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 and has trample.
When a creature with converted mana cost 6 or greater enters the battlefield, you may return Dragon Fangs from your graveyard to the battlefield attached to that creature.

card.name: Dragon Mage
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Dragon Mage deals combat damage to a player, each player discards his or her hand and draws seven cards.
card.flavor: "You'll bend to my will—with or without your precious sanity."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : All players discard, not just the player that was damaged.

card.name: Dragon Scales
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2 and has vigilance.
When a creature with converted mana cost 6 or greater enters the battlefield, you may return Dragon Scales from your graveyard to the battlefield attached to that creature.

card.name: Dragon Shadow
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+0 and has fear. (It can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or black creatures.)
When a creature with converted mana cost 6 or greater enters the battlefield, you may return Dragon Shadow from your graveyard to the battlefield attached to that creature.

card.name: Dragon Tyrant
card.ability:
Flying, trample
Double strike (This creature deals both first-strike and regular combat damage.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Dragon Tyrant unless you pay {R}{R}{R}{R}.
{R}: Dragon Tyrant gets +1/+0 until end of turn.

card.name: Dragon Wings
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has flying.
Cycling {1}{U} ({1}{U}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
When a creature with converted mana cost 6 or greater enters the battlefield, you may return Dragon Wings from your graveyard to the battlefield attached to that creature.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Dragonspeaker Shaman
card.ability: Dragon spells you cast cost {2} less to cast.
card.flavor: "We speak the dragons' language of flame and rage. They speak our language of fury and honor. Together we shall weave a tale of destruction without equal."

card.name: Dragonstalker
card.ability: Flying, protection from Dragons
card.flavor:
"When the skies are filled with flames, the brave shall step forward to quench them."
—Order prophecy

card.name: Dragonstorm
card.ability:
Search your library for a Dragon permanent card and put it onto the battlefield. Then shuffle your library.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)
card.ruling: 4/1/2008 : A "Dragon permanent card" is an artifact, creature, enchantment, land, or planeswalker card with the creature type Dragon. The name of the card is not looked at.

card.name: Edgewalker
card.ability: Cleric spells you cast cost {W}{B} less to cast. This effect reduces only the amount of colored mana you pay. (For example, if you cast a Cleric spell with mana cost {1}{W}, it costs {1} to cast.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you have more than one of these on the battlefield, the cost reduction is cumulative.
8/1/2008 : You apply cost reduction effects after other cost modifiers, so it can reduce additional costs or alternative costs if they include {W} and/or {B}.
8/1/2008 : If a spell has hybrid mana symbols in its mana cost, you choose which half you will be paying before determining the total cost. If you choose to pay such a cost with {W} or {B}, Edgewalker can reduce that part of the cost.

card.name: Elvish Aberration
card.ability:
{T}: Add {G}{G}{G} to your mana pool.
Forestcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Forest card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : Unlike the normal cycling ability, Forestcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Forest card. After you find a Forest card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
2/1/2009 : Forestcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Forestcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Forestcycling from being activated.
2/1/2009 : Forestcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Forestcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
2/1/2009 : You can choose to find any card with the Forest land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Forest card in your library.

card.name: Enrage
card.ability: Target creature gets +X/+0 until end of turn.
card.flavor: "You wouldn't like me when I'm angry."

card.name: Eternal Dragon
card.ability:
Flying
{3}{W}{W}: Return Eternal Dragon from your graveyard to your hand. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
Plainscycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Plains card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : Unlike the normal cycling ability, Plainscycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Plains card. After you find a Plains card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
2/1/2009 : Plainscycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Plainscycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Plainscycling from being activated.
2/1/2009 : Plainscycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Plainscycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
2/1/2009 : You can choose to find any card with the Plains land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Plains card in your library.

card.name: Exiled Doomsayer
card.ability: All morph costs cost {2} more. (This doesn't affect the cost to cast creature spells face down.)
card.flavor: He's desperate to hold back the future because he has seen it.

card.name: Extra Arms
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks, it deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.flavor:
"Perhaps extra heads would have served them better."
—Foothill guide

card.name: Faces of the Past
card.ability: Whenever a creature dies, tap all untapped creatures that share a creature type with it or untap all tapped creatures that share a creature type with it.
card.flavor: The ties that bind can also strangle.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : You choose whether to tap or untap during resolution.
10/4/2004 : You either tap all of them or untap all of them. You can't tap some and untap others.

card.name: Fatal Mutation
card.ability:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature is turned face up, destroy it. It can't be regenerated.
card.flavor:
"You wear that shell as a mask. Now it's your coffin."
—Cabal cleric

card.name: Fierce Empath
card.ability: When Fierce Empath enters the battlefield, you may search your library for a creature card with converted mana cost 6 or greater, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.

card.name: Final Punishment
card.ability: Target player loses life equal to the damage already dealt to him or her this turn.
card.flavor: The pain of a lifetime—every scrape, illness, and bruise—condensed into a single moment.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : Damage that is prevented does not count toward the total.

card.name: Force Bubble
card.ability:
If damage would be dealt to you, put that many depletion counters on Force Bubble instead.
When there are four or more depletion counters on Force Bubble, sacrifice it.
At the beginning of each end step, remove all depletion counters from Force Bubble.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you control more than one, each time you take damage you can decide which one replaces the damage, and that one replaces all of the damage. You can't split the damage between them. You decide each time you take damage. Note that damage from multiple sources that happens at one time (such as combat damage) gives one choice, not one per source.
10/4/2004 : If you take 6 damage at once, it will replace all 6 damage and put 6 counters on it. Then the second ability will trigger. Any additional damage you take before this ability resolves also results in counters, but once the ability resolves, this card is sacrificed.
10/4/2004 : The effect does not prevent damage, it replaces it so the damage is neither dealt or prevented.

card.name: Forgotten Ancient
card.ability:
Whenever a player casts a spell, you may put a +1/+1 counter on Forgotten Ancient.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may move any number of +1/+1 counters from Forgotten Ancient onto other creatures.
card.flavor: Its blood is life. Its body is growth.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : It does not get counters for copies of spells (as with Storm), just for spells that are actually cast.
10/4/2004 : The moving of counters is not a targeted ability.
10/4/2004 : You decide how many counters to move and where to move them when the ability resolves.
10/4/2004 : Putting on a counter is optional. If you forget to do so, it means you chose not to do so.

card.name: Form of the Dragon
card.ability:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Form of the Dragon deals 5 damage to target creature or player.
At the beginning of each end step, your life total becomes 5.
Creatures without flying can't attack you.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you life total was above 5 at end of turn, then you lose life to make your total 5. If it was less than 5, you gain life to bring it to 5.
10/4/2004 : It sets your life total at the beginning of the end step of every player's turn, not just your own.

card.name: Frontline Strategist
card.ability:
Morph {W} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Frontline Strategist is turned face up, prevent all combat damage non-Soldier creatures would deal this turn.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The creature type is checked for "non-Soldier" at the time the damage would be dealt. If the creature that is dealing the damage is not on the battlefield, use its creature type right before it left the battlefield.

card.name: Frozen Solid
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
When enchanted creature is dealt damage, destroy it.

card.name: Gilded Light
card.ability:
You gain shroud until end of turn. (You can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor: "Whoever survives the first blow lives to land the second."
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Goblin Brigand
card.ability: Goblin Brigand attacks each turn if able.
card.flavor: After the Skirk Ridge collapsed, the goblins erected a system of ropes and pulleys to hold up what was left.

card.name: Goblin Psychopath
card.ability: Whenever Goblin Psychopath attacks or blocks, flip a coin. If you lose the flip, the next time it would deal combat damage this turn, it deals that damage to you instead.
card.flavor: The destruction he causes is nothing next to the chaos in his mind.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability triggers when it attacks or block and resolves before combat damage is assigned. This gives you a chance to possibly get rid of it before it hurts you.

card.name: Goblin War Strike
card.ability: Goblin War Strike deals damage equal to the number of Goblins you control to target player.
card.flavor: "Fire, aim, ready"

card.name: Goblin Warchief
card.ability:
Goblin spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Goblin creatures you control have haste.
card.flavor: They poured from the Skirk Ridge like lava, burning and devouring everything in their path.

card.name: Grip of Chaos
card.ability: Whenever a spell or ability is put onto the stack, if it has a single target, reselect its target at random. (Select from among all legal targets.)
card.flavor: When the world is consumed by chaos, the skilled and the foolish are on equal footing.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If there are multiple legal targets, it may still choose the original one.
10/4/2004 : If there are no other legal targets, it keeps its target.
10/4/2004 : The ability triggers when a spell or ability is put on the stack, and this target-changing ability itself goes on the stack. This means that the spell or ability keeps its original target until this ability resolves. You determine the new target when this ability resolves, at which time the set of legal targets may have changed.

card.name: Guilty Conscience
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, Guilty Conscience deals that much damage to that creature.
card.flavor:
Those who most feel guilt don't need to, while those who most need to feel guilt never do.
—Order proverb

card.name: Hindering Touch
card.ability:
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

card.name: Hunting Pack
card.ability:
Put a 4/4 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)

card.name: Karona, False God
card.ability:
Haste
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, that player untaps Karona, False God and gains control of it.
Whenever Karona attacks, creatures of the creature type of your choice get +3/+3 until end of turn.

card.name: Karona's Zealot
card.ability:
Morph {3}{W}{W} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Karona's Zealot is turned face up, all damage that would be dealt to it this turn is dealt to target creature instead.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If the targeted creature leaves the battlefield or stops being a creature before the damage would be dealt, then the damage is not redirected. For example, if you choose a 1/1 creature, then this card would take 3 damage, all 3 is directed to the 1/1 creature, which then dies. If this card would take an additional 3 damage later in the turn, the 1/1 creature is no longer on the battlefield so the damage is not redirected.

card.name: Krosan Drover
card.ability: Creature spells you cast with converted mana cost 6 or greater cost {2} less to cast.
card.flavor: "Sit."

card.name: Krosan Warchief
card.ability:
Beast spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
{1}{G}: Regenerate target Beast.
card.flavor: It turns prey into predator.

card.name: Kurgadon
card.ability: Whenever you cast a creature spell with converted mana cost 6 or greater, put three +1/+1 counters on Kurgadon.
card.flavor: When it walks through Krosa, trees step aside, leaves take wing, and the ground shudders.

card.name: Lethal Vapors
card.ability:
Whenever a creature enters the battlefield, destroy it.
{0}: Destroy Lethal Vapors. You skip your next turn. Any player may activate this ability.
card.flavor: The vapors infiltrate every crevice, poison every lung, and snuff out every life.

card.name: Lingering Death
card.ability:
Enchant creature
At the beginning of the end step of enchanted creature's controller, that player sacrifices that creature.
card.flavor:
"Looks bad. I don't know if he'll make it through the night."
—Cabal cleric

card.name: Long-Term Plans
card.ability: Search your library for a card, shuffle your library, then put that card third from the top.
card.flavor: "Wait, it'll come to me in a minute."
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If there are fewer than 3 cards in your library, put the card on the bottom of your library.

card.name: Mercurial Kite
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Mercurial Kite deals combat damage to a creature, tap that creature. That creature doesn't untap during its controller's next untap step.

card.name: Metamorphose
card.ability: Put target permanent an opponent controls on top of its owner's library. That opponent may put an artifact, creature, enchantment, or land card from his or her hand onto the battlefield.
card.flavor: If it's not one thing, it's another.

card.name: Mind's Desire
card.ability:
Shuffle your library. Then exile the top card of your library. Until end of turn, you may play that card without paying its mana cost. (If it has X in its mana cost, X is 0.)
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If the card is not played by end of turn, it remains exiled until end of game.
10/4/2004 : The card is face-up when exiled.

card.name: Mischievous Quanar
card.ability:
{3}{U}{U}: Turn Mischievous Quanar face down.
Morph {1}{U}{U} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Mischievous Quanar is turned face up, copy target instant or sorcery spell. You may choose new targets for that copy.
card.ruling: 4/15/2013 : If a spell with split second is on the stack, you can still respond by turning this creature face up and targeting that spell with the trigger. This is because split second only stops players from casting spells or activating abilities, while turning a creature face up is a special action.

card.name: Misguided Rage
card.ability: Target player sacrifices a permanent.
card.flavor: Only when the anger passed did Varv realize he had burned down his home, destroyed his weapons, and killed his friend Furt.

card.name: Mistform Warchief
card.ability:
Creature spells you cast that share a creature type with Mistform Warchief cost {1} less to cast.
{T}: Mistform Warchief becomes the creature type of your choice until end of turn.

card.name: Nefashu
card.ability: Whenever Nefashu attacks, up to five target creatures each get -1/-1 until end of turn.
card.flavor: Where the nefashu pass, blood rolls like a silk carpet.

card.name: Noble Templar
card.ability:
Vigilance
Plainscycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Plains card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)

card.name: One with Nature
card.ability:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature deals combat damage to a player, you may search your library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.

card.name: Parallel Thoughts
card.ability:
When Parallel Thoughts enters the battlefield, search your library for seven cards, exile them in a face-down pile, and shuffle that pile. Then shuffle your library.
If you would draw a card, you may instead put the top card of the pile you exiled into your hand.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : If you have fewer than 7 cards in your library, exile them all.
10/4/2004 : You can choose to take the top card from the pile (and not draw) even if there are no cards in the pile. This allows you to skip draws.
10/4/2004 : You can't look at the face down cards.

card.name: Pemmin's Aura
card.ability:
Enchant creature
{U}: Untap enchanted creature.
{U}: Enchanted creature gains flying until end of turn.
{U}: Enchanted creature gains shroud until end of turn. (It can't be the target of spells or abilities.)
{1}: Enchanted creature gets +1/-1 or -1/+1 until end of turn.

card.name: Primitive Etchings
card.ability: Reveal the first card you draw each turn. Whenever you reveal a creature card this way, draw a card.
card.flavor: Ancient carvings in the trees of Krosa glow with power once again.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If you have more than one of these cards on the battlefield, only one card is revealed (both of them reveal the same card). Both of them will trigger if this card is a creature and thereby allow you to draw 2 cards.

card.name: Proteus Machine
card.ability:
Morph {0} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Proteus Machine is turned face up, it becomes the creature type of your choice. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)

card.name: Putrid Raptor
card.ability: Morph—Discard a Zombie card. (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: It eagerly gobbles up bits of its own rotting flesh as they fall to the swampy ground.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : You can use a text-changing effect that changes creature types on this card while is it face down to change Zombie to something else. This will change the type of card you have to discard to turn it face up.

card.name: Pyrostatic Pillar
card.ability: Whenever a player casts a spell with converted mana cost 3 or less, Pyrostatic Pillar deals 2 damage to that player.

card.name: Rain of Blades
card.ability: Rain of Blades deals 1 damage to each attacking creature.
card.flavor: Some say they are the weapons of heroes fallen in battle, eager for one last chance at glory.

card.name: Raven Guild Initiate
card.ability: Morph—Return a Bird you control to its owner's hand. (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: The Raven Guild soars on winds of unease.

card.name: Raven Guild Master
card.ability:
Whenever Raven Guild Master deals combat damage to a player, that player exiles the top ten cards of his or her library.
Morph {2}{U}{U} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)

card.name: Reaping the Graves
card.ability:
Return target creature card from your graveyard to your hand.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

card.name: Recuperate
card.ability: Choose one — You gain 6 life; or prevent the next 6 damage that would be dealt to target creature this turn.
card.flavor:
"Rise once more, so you may continue to destroy our enemies."
—Karona, false god

card.name: Reward the Faithful
card.ability: Any number of target players each gain life equal to the highest converted mana cost among permanents you control.
card.flavor: "When you have drunk your fill, pass the cup to others who thirst."

card.name: Riptide Survivor
card.ability:
Morph {1}{U}{U} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Riptide Survivor is turned face up, discard two cards, then draw three cards.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : If you have less than 2 cards in your hand, discard all the cards you have. If you have no cards in hand, you can discard zero and draw 3.

card.name: Rock Jockey
card.ability:
You can't cast Rock Jockey if you've played a land this turn.
You can't play lands if you've cast Rock Jockey this turn.
card.flavor: Goblins don't know much about physics, but they know lots about falling and rocks.
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : The first ability applies only while this card is in your hand (or someplace else you can cast it from).
10/4/2004 : The second ability applies only while this card is on the battlefield.

card.name: Root Elemental
card.ability:
Morph {5}{G}{G} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Root Elemental is turned face up, you may put a creature card from your hand onto the battlefield.

card.name: Rush of Knowledge
card.ability: Draw cards equal to the highest converted mana cost among permanents you control.
card.flavor:
"Limitless power is glorious until you gain limitless understanding."
—Ixidor, reality sculptor

card.name: Scattershot
card.ability:
Scattershot deals 1 damage to target creature.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

card.name: Scornful Egotist
card.ability: Morph {U} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: "Once I was human. Now I am far more."

card.name: Shoreline Ranger
card.ability:
Flying
Islandcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for an Island card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : Unlike the normal cycling ability, Islandcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for an Island card. After you find an Island card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
2/1/2009 : Islandcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Islandcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Islandcycling from being activated.
2/1/2009 : Islandcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Islandcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
2/1/2009 : You can choose to find any card with the Island land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is an Island card in your library.

card.name: Siege-Gang Commander
card.ability:
When Siege-Gang Commander enters the battlefield, put three 1/1 red Goblin creature tokens onto the battlefield.
{1}{R}, Sacrifice a Goblin: Siege-Gang Commander deals 2 damage to target creature or player.
card.ruling:
10/1/2009 : You can sacrifice any Goblin you control to activate Siege-Gang Commander's activated ability, not just the ones its triggered ability puts onto the battlefield. You can even sacrifice Siege-Gang Commander itself.
10/1/2009 : If you sacrifice an attacking or blocking Goblin during the declare blockers step, it won't deal combat damage. If you wait until the combat damage step, but that Goblin has been dealt lethal damage, it'll be destroyed before you get a chance to sacrifice it.

card.name: Silver Knight
card.ability: First strike, protection from red
card.flavor: Otaria's last defense against the wave of chaos threatening to engulf it.

card.name: Skirk Volcanist
card.ability:
Morph—Sacrifice two Mountains. (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Skirk Volcanist is turned face up, it deals 3 damage divided as you choose among one, two, or three target creatures.

card.name: Skulltap
card.ability:
As an additional cost to cast Skulltap, sacrifice a creature.
Draw two cards.
card.flavor:
"Finally, a use for that head of yours."
—Braids, dementia summoner
card.ruling:
4/15/2013 : You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
4/15/2013 : Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

card.name: Sliver Overlord
card.ability:
{3}: Search your library for a Sliver card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
{3}: Gain control of target Sliver. (This effect lasts indefinitely.)
card.flavor: The end of evolution.

card.name: Soul Collector
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever a creature dealt damage by Soul Collector this turn dies, return that card to the battlefield under your control.
Morph {B}{B}{B} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : The ability only triggers if this card is face up at the time the creature is put into the graveyard.

card.name: Spark Spray
card.ability:
Spark Spray deals 1 damage to target creature or player.
Cycling {R} ({R}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor: It's the only kind of shower goblins will tolerate.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Sprouting Vines
card.ability:
Search your library for a basic land card, reveal that card, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)

card.name: Stabilizer
card.ability: Players can't cycle cards.
card.flavor:
"Hold that thought."
—Pemmin, Riptide survivor
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : This affects both Cycling and Landcycling.

card.name: Stifle
card.ability: Counter target activated or triggered ability. (Mana abilities can't be targeted.)
card.flavor:
"If I wanted your opinion, I'd have told you what it was."
—Pemmin, Riptide survivor
card.ruling:
10/4/2004 : An activated ability has a "Cost: Effect" format. Look for the colon. A triggered ability starts with "when", "whenever", or "at".
10/4/2004 : Turn-based actions and special actions like the normal card draw, combat damage, or turning a face-down creature face up can't be targeted.
10/4/2004 : It can target delayed triggered abilities. For example, a card that says "Whenever a player cycles a card, you may exile target creature. If you do, return that creature to the battlefield at the beginning of the end step." triggers when a player cycles a card and creates a delayed trigger that happens at the beginning of the end step. You can choose to target the "at the beginning of the end step" trigger when it is placed on the stack at end of turn.

card.name: Sulfuric Vortex
card.ability:
At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Sulfuric Vortex deals 2 damage to that player.
If a player would gain life, that player gains no life instead.

card.name: Temple of the False God
card.ability: {T}: Add {2} to your mana pool. Activate this ability only if you control five or more lands.
card.flavor: Those who bring nothing to the temple take nothing away.

card.name: Temporal Fissure
card.ability:
Return target permanent to its owner's hand.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

card.name: Tendrils of Agony
card.ability:
Target player loses 2 life and you gain 2 life.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn. You may choose new targets for the copies.)

card.name: Thundercloud Elemental
card.ability:
Flying
{3}{U}: Tap all creatures with toughness 2 or less.
{3}{U}: All other creatures lose flying until end of turn.
card.flavor: Some days it's better to stay inside.

card.name: Titanic Bulvox
card.ability:
Trample
Morph {4}{G}{G}{G} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: With natural laws abandoned, excess thrives.

card.name: Torrent of Fire
card.ability: Torrent of Fire deals damage equal to the highest converted mana cost among permanents you control to target creature or player.
card.flavor: Dragon fire melts any instrument designed to measure it.

card.name: Trap Digger
card.ability:
{2}{W}, {T}: Put a trap counter on target land you control.
Sacrifice a land with a trap counter on it: Trap Digger deals 3 damage to target attacking creature without flying.

card.name: Treetop Scout
card.ability: Treetop Scout can't be blocked except by creatures with flying.
card.flavor: At home among the swaying, supple branches of the treetops, some scouts live their entire lives never touching ground.
card.ruling: 5/1/2007 : Creatures with the Reach ability (such as Giant Spider) don’t actually have Flying, so they can’t block this.

card.name: Twisted Abomination
card.ability:
{B}: Regenerate Twisted Abomination.
Swampcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Swamp card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : Unlike the normal cycling ability, Swampcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Swamp card. After you find a Swamp card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
2/1/2009 : Swampcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Swampcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Swampcycling from being activated.
2/1/2009 : Swampcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Swampcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
2/1/2009 : You can choose to find any card with the Swamp land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Swamp card in your library.

card.name: Unburden
card.ability:
Target player discards two cards.
Cycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor: Cabal initiates enter training full of hopes and fears. They graduate with neither.
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Uncontrolled Infestation
card.ability:
Enchant nonbasic land
When enchanted land becomes tapped, destroy it.
card.flavor: The grounds of the Riptide Project are now populated only by slivers, broken beakers, and the lonely screeching of gulls.
card.ruling: 10/4/2004 : It only triggers if the land becomes tapped after this Aura is on it. Attaching it to a tapped land will not destroy the land until the next time the land is untapped and then tapped again.

card.name: Undead Warchief
card.ability:
Zombie spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.
Zombie creatures you control get +2/+1.
card.flavor: It has the strength of seven men. In fact, it used to be seven men.

card.name: Unspeakable Symbol
card.ability: Pay 3 life: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature.
card.flavor: The symbols are spread throughout Aphetto, marking sites where minions of the Raven Guild and the Cabal can seek refuge.

card.name: Upwelling
card.ability: Mana pools don't empty as steps and phases end.
card.flavor: Once again, Kamahl felt the full force of the Mirari's pull, but he had learned much since the last time.
card.ruling: 10/1/2009 : Players can keep mana in their pool indefinitely while this is on the battlefield, but once it leaves the battlefield, they have until the end of the current step (or phase) to use the mana before it disappears.

card.name: Vengeful Dead
card.ability: Whenever Vengeful Dead or another Zombie dies, each opponent loses 1 life.
card.flavor: Those who don't learn from their deaths are destined to repeat them.

card.name: Wing Shards
card.ability:
Target player sacrifices an attacking creature.
Storm (When you cast this spell, copy it for each spell cast before it this turn.)

card.name: Wipe Clean
card.ability:
Exile target enchantment.
Cycling {3} ({3}, Discard this card: Draw a card.)
card.flavor: "The light of the Ancestor will scour the taint of darkness from the land."
card.ruling: 10/1/2008 : Cycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with cycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.

card.name: Wirewood Guardian
card.ability: Forestcycling {2} ({2}, Discard this card: Search your library for a Forest card, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Then shuffle your library.)
card.flavor: Tall as a tree and probably related.
card.ruling:
2/1/2009 : Unlike the normal cycling ability, Forestcycling doesn't allow you to draw a card. Instead, it lets you search your library for a Forest card. After you find a Forest card in your library, you reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle your library.
2/1/2009 : Forestcycling is a form of cycling. Any ability that triggers on a card being cycled also triggers on Forestcycling this card. Any ability that stops a cycling ability from being activated also stops Forestcycling from being activated.
2/1/2009 : Forestcycling is an activated ability. Effects that interact with activated abilities (such as Stifle or Rings of Brighthearth) will interact with Forestcycling. Effects that interact with spells (such as Remove Soul or Faerie Tauntings) will not.
2/1/2009 : You can choose to find any card with the Forest land type, including nonbasic lands. You can also choose not to find a card, even if there is a Forest card in your library.

card.name: Wirewood Symbiote
card.ability: Return an Elf you control to its owner's hand: Untap target creature. Activate this ability only once each turn.
card.flavor: It drinks fatigue.

card.name: Woodcloaker
card.ability:
Morph {2}{G}{G} (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
When Woodcloaker is turned face up, target creature gains trample until end of turn.

card.name: Xantid Swarm
card.ability:
Flying
Whenever Xantid Swarm attacks, defending player can't cast spells this turn.
card.flavor: When they land on you, all you can think about is tearing them off.

card.name: Zealous Inquisitor
card.ability: {1}{W}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Zealous Inquisitor this turn is dealt to target creature instead.
card.flavor: "I only return what rightly belongs to another."

card.name: Zombie Cutthroat
card.ability: Morph—Pay 5 life. (You may cast this face down as a 2/2 creature for {3}. Turn it face up any time for its morph cost.)
card.flavor: The single-mindedness of a zombie, the cunning of an assassin.
